conclusion: Laser beam starts at point A and moves to point C along diameter AC at constant speed V.
Transparent brick is semi-cylindrical with refractive index n and radius r; surface ABC is curved.
For laser to emerge from surface ABC, it must reach the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Critical angle θc is given by θc = arcsin(1/n).
Let laser beam intersect arc at point D, forming angle θ with normal at point D.
If θ = θc, the laser emerges from the surface.
Laser moves horizontally from A to C, covering distance equal to diameter of cylinder, 2r.
Time taken to reach critical angle position is when laser beam is at point D.
Distance AD is found using trigonometry: AD = r sin(θc).
Time to reach point D is t = AD/V = r sin(θc)/V.
The moment when the laser beam emerges from the arc surface ABC is t = r sin(θc)/V.
